title: Biden, Putin Talk as Russian Leader Seeks to Redraw European Security Arrangements
sub_head: Moscow has built up troops near Ukraine and issued demands to NATO and the U.S.
body:
President Biden’s planned talk with Russian President Vladimir Putin on Thursday is part of a pressure tactic the Russian leader is using to try to redraw post-Cold War arrangements in Europe, current and former U.S. officials said.
The call is likely to center on Russia’s demands that the North Atlantic Treaty Organization sever support for Ukraine and U.S. concerns about a Russian troop buildup near Ukraine. The call comes at the request of Mr. Putin, giving him a chance to talk directly with Mr. Biden before their negotiators meet for a series of talks next month.
